page.title: 09DOMESTIC BUILDINGS, S CREAKE
page.content: Most of the dwellings in S Creake are of cottage type, built of brick, flint or both, with pantile roofs. This is because there is not suitable building stone in N Norfolk. Many windows are of the casement variety. A few older houses and barns have clunch or chalk built into some walls. Few of the cottages are more than 200 years old. The exceptions being two of the remaining Manor houses; one now a farm, the other divided into two residences, and three other farmhouses. About a third of the village houses are Council built, and fairly modern, built since 1935; the majority being post-war. These are all brick, with pantiled roofs. A few bungalows for elderly are included. Many of the older cottages are build around 'yards', with little or no garden.
